dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? Five hundred million professionals? From LinkedIn? Seriously?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Five hundred million professionals? From LinkedIn? Seriously?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The recently released LinkedIn 2020 Workplace Learning Report comprised data from almost 500,000,000 professionals, mapped into a list of the 15 most in-demand soft and hard skills.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I know, it's, uh, it's a huge number, right? But it just kinda shows, like, the scale of what we're talking about.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I know, it's, uh, it's a huge number, right? But it just kinda shows, like, the scale of what we're talking about.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Scale of what? Another thing to panic about? Like, oh, now we all have to 're-educate' ourselves, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Scale of what? Another thing to panic about? Like, oh, now we all have to 're-educate' ourselves, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The key in being able to efficiently deal with the growing wave of challenges around us is in re-educating yourself. Here are five strategic steps you can follow to re-educate yourself for new realities

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but, um, the article makes a point. Things are changing so fast. Especially, like, with quantum computing, that's coming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but, um, the article makes a point. Things are changing so fast. Especially, like, with quantum computing, that's coming.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This does not mean that everyone should become a programmer or expert in artificial intelligence (AI); but it implies that everyone should consider mastering additional in-demand hard skills to be ready for the huge changes in the labor market that are foreseeable within the next 12 months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Quantum computing. Great. Just another excuse to make us feel, you know, obsolete unless we learn, like, advanced AI in our spare time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Quantum computing. Great. Just another excuse to make us feel, you know, obsolete unless we learn, like, advanced A I in our spare time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This does not mean that everyone should become a programmer or expert in artificial intelligence (AI); but it implies that everyone should consider mastering additional in-demand hard skills to be ready for the huge changes in the labor market that are foreseeable within the next 12 months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, not just that. It talks about soft skills too. Like, uh, emotional intelligence, leadership. Stuff your boss, uh, values.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, not just that. It talks about soft skills too. Like, uh, emotional intelligence, leadership. Stuff your boss, uh, values.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You should identify, update and study the most critical soft skills that your boss, colleagues or friends value most about you (e.g., agility, motivation, emotional intelligence (EI), leadership).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, fantastic. So now I need a 'pyramid of in-demand soft skills' on a flip chart? Just, like, more homework.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, fantastic. So now I need a 'pyramid of in-demand soft skills' on a flip chart? Just, like, more homework.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its up to you to decide what you need (and want) to develop further by writing out a pyramid of the most in-demand soft skills (perhaps in a flip chart on the wall) and prioritizing what you should address right now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But it's about, like, staying competitive, though. Think about remote work. People really struggled, right? Time management, handling, uh, families...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's about, like, staying competitive, though. Think about remote work. People really struggled, right? Time management, handling, uh, families...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition, there is a need for meticulous time management and people management proficiencies (well, how to handle dexterously a situation when your entire family would like to come to the kitchen every time when you would like to focus on your urgent project or on a teleconference with your boss?).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: My family lives in my kitchen. Is that 're-educating' or just, like, trying to get five minutes of silence?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: My family lives in my kitchen. Is that 're-educating' or just, like, trying to get five minutes of silence?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's... it's about being prepared, though. For the future. Even, um, with social media. They say, like, an hour or two a day polishing your LinkedIn.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's... it's about being prepared, though. For the future. Even, um, with social media. They say, like, an hour or two a day polishing your LinkedIn.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Many recent studies suggest that today people should spend at least 1-2 hours a day on the Internet and social media. What to achieve in this time? You should by polishing your bio and profile on LinkedIn and other professional and job search websites...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: An hour a day on LinkedIn? Are they serious? I can barely remember my password for that place.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: An hour a day on LinkedIn? Are they serious? I can barely remember my password for that place.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but it's not just, um, wasting time. It's about 'reinventing yourself online.' Getting rid of typos, being professional. That's, uh, crucial now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but it's not just, um, wasting time. It's about 'reinventing yourself online.' Getting rid of typos, being professional. That's, uh, crucial now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is important to reinvent yourself in cyberspace by updating and professionalizing your social networking, media marketing and social media communication skills.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I guess. If I have to. So, we're basically saying everyone just needs to, like, go back to school, forever, online.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I guess. If I have to. So, we're basically saying everyone just needs to, like, go back to school, forever, online.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's more, like, continuous learning. To, uh, fill those skill gaps, you know? It's about, um, choosing wisely what you learn.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's more, like, continuous learning. To, uh, fill those skill gaps, you know? It's about, um, choosing wisely what you learn.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The power of online learning offers a lot of opportunities to fill the skill-gap, but be careful not to head out on a wild goose chase; instead, choose carefully and wisely the educational tools suitable for you.
